newsitem.title: JAPAN: U.S. PROPOSES EXTENDING NTT PROCUREMENT PACT - JAPAN.
newsitem.headline: U.S. PROPOSES EXTENDING NTT PROCUREMENT PACT - JAPAN.

text.p: The United States has proposed extending a bilateral agreement on Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp's international procurement, a Japanese government official said on Thursday.
The United States also proposed that more information be released on NTT's procurement practices during an unofficial meeting between the two sides in San Francisco on Wednesday, the official said.
Japan reiterated that it would not discuss the extension issue unless the United States granted telecom licences to NTT and Kokusai Denshin Denwa Co Ltd, he said.
The United States did not make any specific comment on the two companies' licences, he said.
The procurement agreement, which expires on September 30, sets guidelines on NTT's international procurement.

Earlier this year, U.S. regulators told NTT and KDD their applications for licences to offer international long-distance phone services had been put on hold so that Washington could review them over trade concerns.
